slides.title: Types of Seating Arrangements
slides.content:
**1. Linear Arrangement:**
People sitting in a straight line (facing North/South)

**2. Circular Arrangement:**
People sitting around a circular table

**3. Rectangular/Square Table:**
People sitting around rectangular or square tables

**4. Double Row:**
Two rows facing each other

slides.title: Important Concepts
slides.content:
**Facing Direction:**
- Facing North: Left means West, Right means East
- Facing South: Left means East, Right means West

**Circular (Center facing):**
- Left and Right change based on facing direction

**Immediate Left/Right:**
Directly next to the person (no one in between)

slides.title: Solving Strategy
slides.content:
**Step 1:** Read all information carefully

**Step 2:** Draw a diagram (line/circle)

**Step 3:** Mark definite positions first

**Step 4:** Use elimination for uncertain positions

**Step 5:** Cross-verify all conditions

**Step 6:** Answer questions from diagram

slides.title: Common Pitfalls to Avoid
slides.content:
**DON'T:**
- Assume positions without information
- Forget facing directions
- Miss "immediate" keywords
- Rush without drawing diagram

**DO:**
- Mark all given information
- Check each condition
- Use pencil for changes
- Stay calm and methodical
